repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: `yx` prefix is not the best fit for "execute code" mappings.

Solution: use `g=` (in the form of `g==` currently) as it is more
  popularized as "execute code" mapping.
  For example, in 'tpope/vim-scriptease'.

------

Addresses #31904 changes.

comment_regular_data.body: What do people think about `gX`? "x" as a mnemonic ("execute") fits very well, and aligns with `gx`.

> What do people think about `gX`? "x" as a mnemonic ("execute") fits very well, and aligns with `gx`.

I personally prefer `g=` / `g==` as it is more aligned with `=` expression register, is already used for similar context in 'tpope/vim-scriptease', and doesn't require `<Shift>` on regular QWERTY keyboard.
`gX` also works, it feels mostly a matter of taste. It might feel too similar to `gx` which is more like "*open* link" and `gX` might feel the same as `gf` / `gF` pair.

Do you have any specific plans for `g=` or is it not immediately fitting the "execute" mnemonic?

I feel `g==` should be closer to `==` which is for indentation. `gx` already opens the link under the cursor so `gX` is a great fit. I also wouldn't be against somehow using `gx` as an additional behaviour to opening links if that can work in a way that makes sense.

> I personally prefer `g=` / `g==` as it is more aligned with `=` expression register, is already used for similar context in 'tpope/vim-scriptease'

We can keep "=" in our pocket. A minor argument against "=" is that in both of those cases, it inserts text at cursor.

> I also wouldn't be against somehow using `gx` as an additional behaviour to opening links if that can work in a way that makes

Wondering about that too. Or rename the current `gx` functionality to `gX`, so that `gx` can work like an operator. The current `gx` is not an ideal use of such an ergonomic mapping.

> > I personally prefer `g=` / `g==` as it is more aligned with `=` expression register, is already used for similar context in 'tpope/vim-scriptease'
> 
> We can keep "=" in our pocket. A minor argument against "=" is that in both of those cases, it inserts text at cursor.

Yeah, indeed.

I am fine with either `g=` or `gX` (or even `gx`, but slightly less so as it is a breaking change), just not `yx` or any other one that starts with built-in operator. Waiting for the final decision.
To unblock this let's do `gX` for now. If/when we gain a more generic "execute" functionality, we can make the case for swapping gx/gX.

> To unblock this let's do `gX` for now. If/when we gain a more generic "execute" functionality, we can make the case for swapping gx/gX.

Just to clarify: replace `g==` from this PR with `gXX` (*not* plain `gX` to reserve it for future operator), correct?

> Just to clarify: replace `g==` from this PR with `gXX` (_not_ plain `gX` to reserve it for future operator), correct?

That's what I was thinking, but it's pretty ugly. I think we may need to move `gx` now, otherwise there are more problems to unwind later.

## Proposal:

- move netrw `gx` to `gX` now
- create a mapping for `gx` (exactly) which shows a `moved to gX` message if it times out.
- move `yxx` to `gxx`
- also define a alias for the name we expect to use for "codeblock" or "node? e.g.:
    - `gxic` ("codeblock"?), and/or
    - `gxin` ("node"?), and/or
    - `gxib` (already exists for "block", but in help files maybe we want this as an alias)
    - `gxip` (already exists for "paragraph", but in help files maybe we want this as an alias)

> also define a alias for the name we expect to use for "codeblock" or "node? e.g.:
> 
>     * `gxic` ("codeblock"?), and/or
> 
>     * `gxin` ("node"?), and/or
> 
>     * `gxib` (already exists for "block", but in help files maybe we want this as an alias)
> 
>     * `gxip` (already exists for "paragraph", but in help files maybe we want this as an alias)

This can be done separately as a special textobject (Operator-pending mode) in help files and making `gx` a full operator. No need defining Normal mode `gxic`/etc. mappings.

I'll wait until tomorrow for possibly better direction, as breaking `gx` is kind of bad. If no better ideas (stay with `g==`?), I'll prepare a new PR.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(docs): replace `yxx` mappings with `g==`
